content.question: (a) Find the speed of the laser at time <math alttext="t equals 3" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> seconds.

frqParts.text: (a) Find the speed of the laser at time <math alttext="t equals 3" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> seconds.

(b) Find the total distance traveled by the laser from time <math alttext="t equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to time <math alttext="t equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds.

(c) The laser is farthest to the right at time <math alttext="t equals 1.253" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.253</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds. Find the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of the laser’s rightmost position.

(d) What is the difference between the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinates of the laser’s highest position and lowest position for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 3.1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
